summary: This is an email from a Co-Chief of the Narcotics Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, granting conditional permission for an unnamed recipient to temporarily take an unspecified 'Epstein report' to their office for review. The conditions include returning it by 5 pm, treating it as Attorney Eyes Only, and not reproducing it.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Narcotics Unit
persons.role: Co-Chief, Narcotics Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is granting conditional permission for an unnamed recipient to temporarily review an 'Epstein report'.

events.title: Document Review
events.description: An unnamed recipient reviewed an unspecified 'Epstein report' at the sender's office.

events.title: Conditional Release of Report
events.description: The Co-Chief of the Narcotics Unit agrees to let the recipient take the 'Epstein report' to their office for review under strict conditions, including its return by 5 pm.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email concerning the conditional, temporary release of an 'Epstein report' for review.
The sender is a Co-Chief of the Narcotics Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The conditions for releasing the report are strict: it must be returned by 5 pm the same day, treated as Attorney Eyes Only, and not reproduced.
The email indicates ongoing legal activity or review related to the Epstein case as of December 2019.
